title: Bootnode Question
body:
Hi there,

I want to set up a local private chain with 4 nodes. 
The first two are miners,the other two are normal nodes.
Hope there is a bootnode to set up p2p network of auto-discovery instead of adding peers mannually.

### Configuration:
1 CentOS7
2 Go-ethereum version: geth-alltools-linux-amd64-1.8.27-4bcc0a37.tar.gz
3 All program run on a virtualbox(v5.2.18) VM

the below is my operation steps:
### S1:create account for each node 
geth --datadir ./enode1/data account new
geth --datadir ./enode2/data account new
geth --datadir ./enode3/data account new
geth --datadir ./enode4/data account new
note: here . is "/root/eth4" path

### S2:create genesis file(named privatechain.json), and make node1 node2 be sealers, node3 node4 be normal nodes

### S3:Initialize four nodes with genesis file "privatechain.json"
geth --datadir **enode1**/data init /root/eth4/privatechain.json
geth --datadir **enode2**/data init /root/eth4/privatechain.json
geth --datadir **enode3**/data init /root/eth4/privatechain.json
geth --datadir **enode4**/data init /root/eth4/privatechain.json

### S4:create and launch bootnode
In folder /root/eth4, execute the commands:
1 bootnode --genkey=boot.key

2 cat boot.key  -----> 0c42412caf8d73bb693f234dfc5e0f4e08d2c77fff61a054576a2b1cb0ea7143

3 bootnode --nodekeyhex 0c42412caf8d73bb693f234dfc5e0f4e08d2c77fff61a054576a2b1cb0ea7143 -writeaddress -----> 3c1091bf6b9312e49d743a832b066720b95fa972fd84dae08291e91a4f3e0bf8320abd4bf2cb464602273ed778afa22a05e5035ff94a5ba1b54efb67d3f229de

4 geth --bootnodes "enode://3c1091bf6b9312e49d743a832b066720b95fa972fd84dae08291e91a4f3e0bf8320abd4bf2cb464602273ed778afa22a05e5035ff94a5ba1b54efb67d3f229de@[192.168.43.155]:30301"

note: my local IP address is 192.168.43.155

### S5: start four nodes:
geth --networkid 123456 --rpc --rpcport "**8545**" --rpccorsdomain "*" --datadir ./**enode1**/data --port "**2001**"  --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpcapi "admin,db,eth,miner,web3,net,personal,txpool" --bootnodes "enode://3c1091bf6b9312e49d743a832b066720b95fa972fd84dae08291e91a4f3e0bf8320abd4bf2cb464602273ed778afa22a05e5035ff94a5ba1b54efb67d3f229de@[192.168.43.155]:30301"  --unlock **'0x8f7d57bfc8a30e778a08092ae281f088e14410f6'** --password password1.txt

> I notice only IPC endpoint opened, is it needed to open HTTP endpoint? and how?

You _can_, that would be `--rpc` to open that. 

> the second I launch bootnode with networkid 123456, but the chainID after launch is 1 which is the bold word above.

The `networkid` and `chainid` are not identical. The `chainid` is specified in the genesis, the `networkid` is a p2p thingy to find the right peers. Ideally you want them to be identical, so you need to specify it to `123456` in the genesis you're using. 
Your bootnode is using `ethash` -- basically mainnet, whereas the signers are using clique. 

So that's probably also why transactions aren't propagated, and you're having a bad time.
